name: Queer Britain Reopening - Queer Print Exhibition
description: Deep dive into radical print cultures, showcasing magazines, flyers, posters and zines from the Queer Britain archive. Also featuring 40 Years of BFI Flare exhibition and new Collections Gallery with section on Black Lesbian and Gay Centre.

name: Radical Roots: Rediscovering our lost LGBTQ theatre histories
description: Unfinished Histories presents a celebratory night of playreadings by two acclaimed LGBTQ+ Hackney writers working in the 1980s.

name: The BBC's First Homosexual - Salford
description: Inkbrew Productions presents a new play revealing a forgotten landmark moment in queer broadcasting history. In 1954, the BBC produced its first documentary on male homosexuality.

name: The BBC's First Homosexual - Salford Day 2
description: Inkbrew Productions touring play continues at New Adelphi Theatre.

name: The BBC's First Homosexual - Birmingham
description: Inkbrew Productions touring play at Crescent Theatre Birmingham.

name: The BBC's First Homosexual - Brighton
description: Inkbrew Productions touring play at Lantern Theatre Brighton.

name: The BBC's First Homosexual - Brighton Day 2
description: Inkbrew Productions touring play continues at Lantern Theatre.

name: The Night Larry Kramer Kissed Me - Manchester
description: Part love letter, part rallying cry. David Drake's award-winning solo play described as theatre as activism. Made for LGBT History Month.

name: The Night Larry Kramer Kissed Me - Manchester (through 14 Feb)
description: David Drake's award-winning solo play continues at Hope Mill Theatre through Valentine's Day.

name: The BBC's First Homosexual - London
description: Inkbrew Productions touring play at The Cinema Museum London.

name: The BBC's First Homosexual - London (through 14 Feb)
description: Inkbrew Productions touring play continues at The Cinema Museum through Valentine's Day.

name: Loughborough LGBTQ+ Art Exhibition: Beyond the Binary
description: Innovation without Limits - LGBTQ+ Art Exhibition running throughout LGBT History Month.

name: Loughborough Colloquium on LGBTQI+ Research
description: Academic colloquium featuring LGBTQI+ research presentations. Part of LGBT+ History Month 2026 theme: Science and Innovation.

name: Creative Workshop: LGBT+ Stories of Care - Newham
description: Explores queer histories of health, disability and care through archives, oral histories and creative making.

name: National Gallery LGBTQ+ Tour and Talk
description: Gallery Educator Dr Tilly Scantlebury leads a tour through the collection using a queer lens. British Sign Language interpretation provided.

name: The BBC's First Homosexual - Liverpool
description: Inkbrew Productions touring play at Hope Street Theatre Liverpool.

name: The BBC's First Homosexual - Liverpool Day 2
description: Inkbrew Productions touring play continues at Hope Street Theatre.

name: Queer East London Fest 2026
description: Tower Hamlets LGBT+ Community Forum presents celebration of queer culture, art, and community with activities, workshops, community marketplace and pop-up cinema.

name: Rotten Crip Collective Launch - Lewisham
description: Evening of queer crip performance, cabaret, music, art and celebration featuring the launch of ROTTEN vol.1.

name: Jonny Woo Play Sharing - Newham
description: Work-in-progress sharing from a new play set in a 1960s gay pub in the Royal Docks, followed by Q&A with Jonny Woo.

name: The Log Books: Voices of Queer Britain - Lewisham
description: Talk by Tash Walker and Adam Zmith plus social/afternoon tea. Stories from the helpline that listened.

name: LGBT+ History Month: Hazlerigg Illuminations - Loughborough
description: Special illuminations at The Lounge, Students' Union for LGBT+ History Month.

name: The BBC's First Homosexual - Loughborough
description: Inkbrew Productions touring play at Loughborough University.

name: The BBC's First Homosexual - Loughborough Day 2
description: Inkbrew Productions touring play continues at Loughborough University.

name: The Stage Sets Collapse - Lewisham
description: Evening of readings, film and performance in which trans artists reflect on their positionality.

name: Any Old Iron: Queer Music Hall History - Lewisham
description: Shedding light on the rich history of music hall and the significant queer presence, including a reading of Fine and Dandy, a groundbreaking queer play.

name: Heightened Scrutiny Screening + Q&A - Lewisham
description: Film screening plus Q&A for LGBT+ History Month.

name: Southend Winter Pride
description: Annual winter pride celebration in Southend-on-Sea.

name: Out at Sea Festival - Greenwich
description: National Maritime Museum's free week-long festival celebrating queer maritime history through time.

name: Fierce Queens 2026 Costume Workshop - Greenwich
description: Costume workshop as part of LGBTQ+ History Month celebrations at Royal Museums Greenwich.

name: British Museum LGBTQ+ Tour: Desire Love Identity
description: Free walking tour exploring LGBTQ+ stories and objects in the British Museum collection. Booking required - sells out quickly.

name: Queer Westminster Walking Tour
description: Philip Scott leads queer tours of Westminster from Stuart period to present day, meeting figures like trans fencer Chevalier D'Eon and Oscar Wilde.

name: Re/Assemble: Section 28 Exhibition - Manchester
description: Exhibition starting point is the largest LGBT+ demonstration in British history, when 20,000 people gathered in Manchester in 1988 to protest against Section 28.

name: Bishopsgate Institute LGBTQ+ Archive Visit
description: Explore the massive LGBTQ+ archive featuring personal photo collections and the UK Leather and Fetish Archives. Booking required.

name: Oh Mary! - Trafalgar Theatre
description: Cole Escola's smash-hit Broadway comedy. Tony-winning dark comedy starring Mason Alexander Park as Mary Todd Lincoln.

name: Already Perfect Musical - King's Head Theatre
description: New musical by Tony Award winner Levi Kreis. Running January to February 2026.

name: Cabaret at Kit Cat Club
description: Bold and daring immersive production of Cabaret at the Playhouse Theatre. Experience Berlin's seedier side.

name: QueerFest Norwich 2026
description: QueerFest returns for LGBTQ+ History Month with exhibition and film programme.

name: Queer Night Watch Outdoor Film Trail - Shoreham
description: Film and video works projected onto buildings around Shoreham. Celebrating LGBTQIA+ community through outdoor cinema.

name: Iris on the Move - UK Tour Launch
description: Annual touring programme sharing the best LGBTQ+ films from Iris Prize Festival with venues across the UK.

name: OUTing the Past Festival 2026
description: International Festival of Lesbian, Gay, Bisexual & Trans History. Events at museums, archives and libraries across UK.

name: A Queer Night at the Museum - Brighton
description: Special evening event at Brighton Museum celebrating LGBTQ+ histories.

name: Gaydio Networking Event - Hard Rock Cafe
description: Networking event hosted by Gaydio featuring entertainment, drinks, canapes and mingling.

name: Tate Modern LGBTQ+ Tour
description: LGBTQ+ themed tour exploring works of queer artists and the stories behind them.

name: LGBT+ History Month Quiz - Pixie's Wood Street
description: Test your knowledge on LGBTQ+ history, culture and icons at this pub quiz.

name: BFI Flare 40th Anniversary Programme Announcement
description: Programme revealed for 40th anniversary edition of Europe's largest LGBTQ+ film festival (18-29 March).
